title: Ejercicios: Cumplimiento Regulatorio Global e Inversión para Énfasis

exercises.question: Never ________ such a strict regulatory framework in the history of the banking sector.
exercises.explanation: When 'Never' starts a sentence, the auxiliary verb must come before the subject (Inversion).

exercises.question: Only ________ the compliance audit was finished did the CEO feel relieved.
exercises.explanation: Inversion with 'Only after...' (Only after [event] + auxiliary + subject + verb).

exercises.question: Under no circumstances ________ the bank disclose confidential client information.
exercises.explanation: 'Under no circumstances' triggers inversion. The auxiliary 'should' comes before the subject.

exercises.question: Seldom ________ a financial crisis have such global repercussions.
exercises.explanation: Inversion with 'Seldom'. The subject 'a financial crisis' is singular, so 'does' is used.

exercises.question: Hardly ________ the new AML law been passed when several firms were investigated.
exercises.explanation: 'Hardly had [subject] [past participle] when...' is a standard literary/formal structure.

exercises.question: Basel III is a global, voluntary regulatory framework on bank capital adequacy and ________ risk.
exercises.explanation: A key innovation of Basel III was the introduction of liquidity requirements (LCR and NSFR).

exercises.question: The LCR (Liquidity Coverage Ratio) requires banks to hold enough high-quality liquid assets to survive a ________-day stress scenario.
exercises.explanation: The LCR focuses on short-term resilience (30 days).

exercises.question: Not only ________ the fine, but they also lost their banking license.
exercises.explanation: Inversion with 'Not only... but also'. 'Not only did they pay...'.

exercises.question: The KYC (Know Your Customer) process is essential for preventing ________.
exercises.explanation: KYC helps verify the identity of clients and prevent fraud and money laundering.

exercises.question: Solvency II is a directive in EU law that codifies and harmonizes the ________ regulation.
exercises.explanation: Solvency II is to insurance what Basel III is to banking.

exercises.question: Little ________ the regulator suspect that the bank was hiding billions in offshore accounts.
exercises.explanation: Inversion with 'Little' to express 'not at all'.

exercises.question: Only by ________ the rules can we ensure the stability of the financial system.
exercises.explanation: 'Only by' is followed by a gerund (-ing).

exercises.question: MiFID II (Markets in Financial Instruments Directive) aims to increase market ________ and investor protection.
exercises.explanation: Transparency is a core goal of MiFID II.

exercises.question: A SAR (Suspicious Activity Report) must be filed when a bank ________ money laundering.
exercises.explanation: Banks have a legal duty to report suspicious transactions.

exercises.question: Not until the investigation was complete ________ the findings released to the public.
exercises.explanation: Inversion in the main clause after 'Not until...'.

exercises.question: No sooner ________ the interest rates been raised than the stock market began to fall.
exercises.explanation: 'No sooner had [subject] [past participle] than [past simple]' is a standard inversion structure.

exercises.question: ________ any evidence of fraud be found, the auditor will notify the authorities.
exercises.explanation: 'Should' at the start replaces 'If' in formal conditionals (Should any evidence be found = If any evidence is found).

exercises.question: Anti-Money Laundering (AML) regulations require banks to perform ________ on all high-risk clients.
exercises.explanation: Enhanced Due Diligence (EDD) is for clients who pose a higher risk.

exercises.question: The NSFR (Net Stable Funding Ratio) is designed to ensure that banks have enough stable ________ to cover their long-term assets.
exercises.explanation: NSFR is a long-term liquidity metric under Basel III.

exercises.question: Scarcely ________ the meeting begun when the news of the default broke.
exercises.explanation: Inversion with 'Scarcely had...'.

exercises.question: Only in this way ________ avoid a total collapse of the credit market.
exercises.explanation: Inversion after 'Only in this way...'.

exercises.question: The 'Volcker Rule' prohibits banks from engaging in ________ trading.
exercises.explanation: Proprietary trading is when a bank trades for its own profit rather than for clients.

exercises.question: A 'PEP' (Politically Exposed Person) is someone who ________ high-risk from an AML perspective.
exercises.explanation: PEPs require closer monitoring due to their potential for involvement in bribery or corruption.

exercises.question: So complex ________ the new regulations that the firm had to hire ten new compliance officers.
exercises.explanation: Inversion after 'So + adjective'. 'So complex were the regulations...'.

exercises.question: Had the board ________ about the risks, they would never have approved the deal.
exercises.explanation: Inversion in the 'if' clause of a third conditional (Had they known = If they had known).

exercises.question: Stress testing involves simulating ________ economic scenarios to see if a bank can survive.
exercises.explanation: Adverse means unfavorable or harmful.

exercises.question: Capital adequacy ratios ensure that a bank has enough ________ to absorb a reasonable amount of loss.
exercises.explanation: Capital acts as a buffer against losses.

exercises.question: Never ________ I seen such a detailed compliance report.
exercises.explanation: Inversion with 'Never have I...'.

exercises.question: Only then ________ the full extent of the fraud become apparent.
exercises.explanation: Inversion after 'Only then...'.

exercises.question: ________ the crisis to worsen, the central bank would intervene.
exercises.explanation: 'Were [subject] to [verb]' is a formal inversion for 'If [subject] [past simple]'.

exercises.question: The 'Three Pillars' of Basel II/III are Minimum Capital Requirements, Supervisory Review, and ________.
exercises.explanation: Market discipline focuses on disclosure requirements.

exercises.question: A 'G-SIB' is a Global ________ Important Bank.
exercises.explanation: G-SIBs are subject to stricter capital requirements due to their size and importance.

exercises.question: On no account ________ staff accept gifts from clients.
exercises.explanation: Inversion after 'On no account...'.

exercises.question: Not for one moment ________ I believe the CFO's explanation.
exercises.explanation: Inversion after 'Not for one moment...'.

exercises.question: ________ the deal to fall through, the company would face bankruptcy.
exercises.explanation: Were the deal to fall through (If the deal were to fall through).

exercises.question: Compliance ________ refers to the risk of legal or regulatory sanctions.
exercises.explanation: Compliance risk is a major focus for financial institutions.

exercises.question: The FATF (Financial Action Task Force) is an intergovernmental organization that sets standards for ________.
exercises.explanation: FATF is the global money laundering and terrorist financing watchdog.

exercises.question: Hardly ________ the ink dried on the contract when they asked for a change.
exercises.explanation: Inversion with 'Hardly had...'.

exercises.question: Scarcely ________ the ink dried ________ they asked for a change.
exercises.explanation: Scarcely/Hardly uses 'when', while No Sooner uses 'than'.

exercises.question: Only by working together ________ the regulators hope to catch the tax evaders.
exercises.explanation: Inversion after 'Only by + [gerund phrase]'.

exercises.question: The 'Leverage Ratio' is a non-risk-based capital requirement introduced in ________.
exercises.explanation: Basel III introduced the leverage ratio as a backstop.

exercises.question: A 'beneficial owner' is the person who ultimately ________ or controls a legal entity.
exercises.explanation: Identifying the beneficial owner is a key part of KYC.

exercises.question: Seldom ________ the regulatory burden been so heavy for small banks.
exercises.explanation: Inversion with 'Seldom has...'.

exercises.question: Only with full cooperation ________ the audit be completed on time.
exercises.explanation: Inversion after 'Only with [noun phrase]'.

exercises.question: A 'Shell Bank' is a bank that has no physical ________ in the country in which it is incorporated.
exercises.explanation: Shell banks are often prohibited in many jurisdictions due to AML risks.

exercises.question: Not until the final report was published ________ the full extent of the losses.
exercises.explanation: Inversion after 'Not until...'.

exercises.question: Under no circumstances ________ employees share their passwords.
exercises.explanation: Inversion after 'Under no circumstances...'.

exercises.question: The 'Whistleblowing' policy protects employees who report ________ activity.
exercises.explanation: Whistleblowing is a key component of corporate governance.

exercises.question: ________ any further questions arise, please do not hesitate to contact us.
exercises.explanation: Formal inversion for 'If any further questions arise'.

exercises.question: Compliance is not just about avoiding fines; it's about building ________ with stakeholders.
exercises.explanation: Trust is a fundamental asset in the financial services industry.
